Package kaitech.model

Class SaleImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • kaitech.model.SaleImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Sale
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SaleTblImpl.DbSale
    public class SaleImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements Sale
    Implements the Sale interface; used to store details about a sale which has occurred.

    • Field Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • SaleImpl

        public SaleImpl​(java.time.LocalDate date,
                java.time.LocalTime time,
                org.joda.money.Money totalPrice,
                PaymentType paymentType,
                java.lang.String notes,
                java.util.Map<MenuItem,​java.lang.Integer> itemsOrdered)
        A run-of-the-mill constructor, except the Business is added as an observer and is notified with the Map of MenuItems ordered.
        Parameters:
        date - The Date of purchase
        time - The Time of purchase
        totalPrice - An int representing the total cost of the sale
        paymentType - The PaymentType value showing the method of payment
        notes - A String where the cashier can leave any additional comments
        itemsOrdered - The Map of MenuItems ordered

      • changeOrderedQuantity

        public void changeOrderedQuantity​(MenuItem item,
                                  int change)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: Sale
        Changes the ordered quantity of the given item by the amount specified. Throws IllegalArgumentException when the MenuItem doesn't exist.
        Specified by:
        changeOrderedQuantity in interface Sale
        Parameters:
        item - The MenuItem to change the ordered quantity of.
        change - The amount to change the quantity of the item by.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When the MenuItem doesn't exist, and when the amount to change by is negative and would decrease the quantity below 0.

      • boundsCheckChange

        protected boolean boundsCheckChange​(java.lang.Integer currentQuant,
                                    int change)
                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Check that the given amount to change the quantity by does not exceed allowable value bounds.
        Parameters:
        currentQuant - The current quantity of the ingredient.
        change - The amount to change the quantity by.
        Returns:
        True if the amount to change by is valid, when it is not valid IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the amount to change the ingredient quantity by is invalid (the ingredient does not exist, or the change would cause the ingredient quantity to be negative).
